Bi is a 3D Dirac semimetal ( 18, 19). Despite being a crucially important chemical component in many topological materials, pure bismuth has long been thought to be topologically trivial. However, distinct from an atomic band insulator, bismuth does have an even number of band inversions ( 10, 20). The existence of these band inversions implies that bismuth cannot be smoothly connected to an atomic band insulator without undergoing closing of its band gap. This suggests that the band topology of bismuth must be far from being trivial ( 8, 9, 20 – 22).
